item.title: Susan add a quote by Paul Newman
item.description: "There are so many qualities that make up a human being... by the time I get through with all the things that I really admire about people, what they do with their private parts is probably so low on the list that it is irrelevant." -- Paul Newman

item.title: Susan add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "All you need is love. But a little chocolate now and then doesn't hurt." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Susan add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "Do you know what breakfast cereal is made of? It's made of all those little curly wooden shavings you find in pencil sharpeners!" -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Susan add a quote by Julia Child
item.description: "The only time to eat diet food is while you're waiting for the steak to cook." -- Julia Child

item.title: Susan add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Susan add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Susan add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Susan add a quote by Margaret Thatcher
item.description: "In politics, If you want anything said, ask a man. If you want anything done, ask a woman." -- Margaret Thatcher

item.title: Susan add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Susan add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Susan add a quote by Amy Tan
item.description: "If you can't change your fate, change your attitude." -- Amy Tan

item.title: Susan add a quote by Shirdi Sai Baba
item.description: "Before you speak ask yourself: Is it kind, is it necessary, it is true, does it improve upon the silence?" -- Shirdi Sai Baba
